p:
In a drug screen of 2177 compounds against the flavivirus Zika, AZM reduced viral proliferation and virus‐induced cytopathic effects in glial cell lines and human astrocytes.
11 A further in vitro study found AZM to effectively suppress Zika infection by targeting a late stage in the viral life cycle.
12 AZM also upregulated expression of type I and III IFNs and several of their downstream ISGs, paralleling activities of AZM in RV.
7 ,
8 Furthermore, AZM induced enhanced expression of the anti‐viral pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) MDA5 and RIG‐1, as well as the levels of phosphorylated TBK1 and IRF3.
